list_definition.definition: a type of small common flower with a yellow centre/center and usually white petals

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The field was full of daisies.

list_ex_of_english: Rather than being driven by an outbreak of daisy-cutters, we need an outbreak of diplomacy.
We have had a very busy night and some of us feel as fresh as daisies.
Although they were rather large, they made excellent daisy chains for children.
It is a flower like a daisy, and its use is that from it is made a powder which is deadly to the malarial mosquito.
The speaker asks the "slight" daisy, "thou little veil for so great a mystery," when she, the poet, might "penetrate all things and thee" (1, 6, 7).
But when the time comes for the rest of us to gather the buttercups, the old people will be pushing up the daisies.
Around the circle are half ovals set like the petals of a daisy.
He, at least, is a rose among daisies.
